title: General Manager Job at PNN Group
content:
PNN is a pan-African technology service provider that began operations out of Nigeria in 1998, playing a significant role in the development of the communications and power sectors of the economy. Over the last 21 years, we have grown into a group of companies focused on the sale, deployment and management of communications and power infrastructure throughout Africa. We provide cost efficient services to our clients, allowing them focus on their core business of service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We're seeking an experienced General Manager to lead our team with a strong background in the Payment Terminal Service Provider (PTSP) industry.
	The ideal candidate will have proven leadership skills, industry expertise, and a track record of driving business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement business strategies to drive growth and profitability (Strategic Leadership)
	Oversee daily operations, ensuring efficiency and compliance (Operations Management)
	Lead and motivate cross-functional teams (Team Management)
	Leverage PTSP knowledge to identify opportunities and mitigate risks (Industry Expertise)
	Foster relationships with partners, vendors, and regulatory bodies (Stakeholder Management)
	Monitor financial performance and ensure sustainable growth (Financial Management)
	Identify and mitigate operational risk, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements (Risk Management)


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field
	5-10 years of experience in the PTSP industry, preferably in a leadership role
	Proven track record of business growth and strategic leadership
	Strong understanding of payment terminal services, industry trends, and regulations
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills
	Strong financial management and analytical skills


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience with payment processing, acquiring, and switching
	Knowledge of industry-specific regulations (e.g., PCI-DSS)
	Familiarity with technology trends in payment terminals.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunity to lead a dynamic team
	Professional growth and development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: hr@pnngroup.net using the Job Position  as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Ziba Consulting
content:
Ziba Consulting - We offer recruitment services to organizations and we are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

1.) General Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Work Schedule: 6 days per week, 8-hour shift

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an experienced and results-driven General Manager to oversee all aspects of restaurant operations, drive profitability, and ensure the highest standards of service and efficiency.
	The ideal candidate has 2–3 years of management experience, with a proven ability to lead teams, streamline processes, and manage performance.
	Experience in the hospitality industry is an added advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee the daily operations of the restaurant, ensuring a smooth, efficient, and profitable workflow.
	Lead and supervise department heads, including restaurant, kitchen, finance, and support teams.
	Develop and implement business strategies that enhance productivity, service quality, and customer satisfaction.
	Manage budgets, control costs, and ensure financial targets are met.
	Monitor inventory, procurement, and supplier relationships for efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and hygiene standards.
	Train, mentor, and evaluate staff performance to build a motivated and capable team.
	Analyze business performance data and prepare regular reports for senior stakeholders.
	Resolve customer complaints and implement service improvements.
	Promote a positive and professional work culture within the organization.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or a related field.
	2 – 3 years of proven experience in a managerial role; experience in the hospitality or restaurant industry is an added advantage.
	Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Financial acumen with experience managing budgets and operational KPIs.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and familiarity with POS or restaurant management systems.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.


Compensation & Benefits


	Competitive salary of N250,000 monthly.
	Performance-based bonuses
	Opportunity for career growth in a reputable and growing brand


Application Closing Date: 21st July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

2.) Internal Auditor

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: 
Work Schedule: 6 days per week, 8-hour shift
Reports to: General Manager

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Internal Auditor to evaluate and enhance our financial and operational performance.
	The ideal candidate will have 2–3 years of relevant auditing experience and a keen eye for identifying risk, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement in processes related to financial controls, compliance, inventory management, and operational procedures.
	You will work closely with the General Manager and senior management to ensure accountability, mitigate risks, and maintain strong internal control systems across all departments.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct regular internal audits across all departments to evaluate internal controls, operational efficiency, and compliance with company policies.
	Review financial documents, accounting records, and transaction processes to ensure accuracy and transparency.
	Work closely with management to implement improvements in internal processes and compliance measures.
	Support management in identifying fraud risks and investigating any irregularities.
	Ensure adherence to financial regulations, statutory laws, and tax compliance.
	Monitor and audit inventory systems to identify stock discrepancies, waste, and theft.
	Assess the effectiveness of procurement, cash handling, payroll, and vendor payment systems.
	Prepare detailed audit reports, highlighting key findings, risks, and recommendations for corrective actions.
	Conduct follow-up audits to ensure previously identified issues have been resolved.
	Provide recommendations to enhance cost control, profitability, and risk management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2–3 years of relevant internal audit or accounting experience (restaurant or hospitality experience is an added advantage).
	Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial reporting, and risk assessment.
	Proficiency in using accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently and communicate audit findings effectively to management.
	Sound knowledge of local tax and financial regulations.
	Professional certification (e.g., ACA, ACCA, CIA) is a plus but not mandatory.
	Candidates in their 40s are advised to apply.


Compensation


	Competitive salary ranging from N170,000 – N200,000 / month.
	Performance-based bonuses


Application Closing Date: 21st July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

3.) Talent Acquisition Specialist

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Reports To: Internal HR & COO

Job Summary


	The Internal Recruiter plays a key role in driving the end-to-end recruitment process by engaging with clients and ensuring that each role is filled efficiently with top-quality candidates.
	This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple recruitment pipelines simultaneously while maintaining excellent client communication.


Key Responsibilities
Client Engagement & Communication:


	Liaise with clients to gather job briefs and clarify role requirements.
	Provide consistent updates to clients on the status of their roles.
	Coordinate interview scheduling, feedback, and follow-up communications.


Recruitment Coordination:


	Submit qualified profiles to clients professionally and on time.
	Conduct initial screening interviews to ensure candidate alignment.


Process Improvement & Oversight:


	Identify bottlenecks or delays in the recruitment process and escalate where necessary.
	Collaborate with the Internal HR Manager to develop and refine recruitment processes and SOPs.
	Ensure consistency and adherence to timelines and client expectations.


Collaboration & Documentation:


	Document all communications, role updates, and feedback accurately.
	Maintain organized records of candidate submissions and client correspondence.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Timeliness of client updates and candidate submissions.
	Client satisfaction and feedback.
	Interview-to-shortlist conversion rate.
	Role Fill rate within agreed timelines.
	Coordination effectiveness with external recruiters.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related fields.
	1–3 years of experience in recruitment, talent acquisition, or HR coordination.
	Strong communication and relationship management skills.
	Ability to multitask and manage multiple roles across various industries.
	Proficiency in Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Gmail), job boards, and sourcing platforms.
	Highly organized, deadline-driven, and detail-oriented.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 18th July, 2025.

title: IT Specialist Job at Unified Payment Services Limited
content:
Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria’s premier Payments & Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Specialist

Job Location: Lagos

Job Objective(s)
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To provide technical support to hope psbank by ensuring optimal functioning of digital banking channels and platforms, implementing new solutions, and maintaining system stability and performance.


Duties & Responsibilties


	Execute technical implementation of new digital banking solutions and upgrades.
	Generate daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance and operations reports.
	Conduct testing and deployment of updates across Hope banking channels including USSD, Internet Banking, Agency, and Mobile platforms.
	Perform continuous monitoring of transactions across all banking channels to ensure seamless operations.
	Track and manage issues using a structured issue management system.
	Conduct daily monitoring and performance checks on the Hope Core Banking Application (PRIME).
	Perform and validate daily data backup procedures.
	Provide second-level support to the Hope PSBank Customer Care team.
	Monitor daily transaction flow on Hope’s processing system (HDP).
	Oversee resource utilization and performance of the Hope Digital Platform servers.
	Undertake assigned ad-hoc tasks to support team and organizational goals.


Job Requirements


	Education: B.Sc. / B.Tech / B.Eng Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant Applied Sciences.
	Experience:
	
		4 - 6 years of relevant experience in system integration, software testing, or quality assurance.
		Experience with agency banking solutions is a strong advantage.
	
	


Key Competency Requirements:
Knowledge: 


	E-payment industry knowledge Behavioural
	Results oriented
	Demonstrates Integrity
	Proactive
	Decisive
	Analytical Creative & Innovative.


Skills & Competencies:


	Proficiency in Postgress, Microsoft SQL Server management studio
	Good troubleshooting and analytical skills.
	Good written and verbal communication skills and excellent collaborative skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ademuyiwa.adetunji@up-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Head, Procurement Job at E?clat Human Resource Consulting
content:
E?clat Human Resource Consulting is a specialized and progressive management firm headquartered in Abuja, Nigeria. Our focus is to enable our clients to achieve their desired outcomes by providing them with bespoke workable systems, structures, and people.

Our team represents a diverse spectrum of professionals who are solution-oriented and dedicated to promoting the practice of statutory ethical business advisory while rendering services for public, private, and third-sector organizations. We understand that every client is unique, therefore we take responsibility for each client’s experience, their firm, and its resources

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Procurement
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
The ideal candidate will (but is not limited to):


	Develop and execute a comprehensive procurement strategy aligned with the overall business objectives and financial goals of the hospitality group/hotel.
	Identify opportunities for cost savings, efficiency improvements, and value creation across all procurement categories.
	Establish and maintain strong, mutually beneficial relationships with key suppliers, vendors, and contractors.
	Lead negotiations for terms, and pricing to secure the most favorable conditions while ensuring quality and service standards.
	Implement and manage inventory control systems to optimize stock levels, minimize waste, and prevent stockouts, particularly for perishable goods.
	Ensure timely delivery of goods and services, coordinating with relevant departments to meet operational demands.
	Develop and implement best practices for purchasing, order placement, receiving, and storage.
	Monitor and report on key procurement metrics, including cost savings, supplier performance, and compliance.
	Develop and implement a robust supplier selection and evaluation process, including due diligence, performance monitoring, and risk assessment.
	Address and resolve supplier performance issues, disputes, and non-compliance promptly and effectively.
	Oversee the entire procure-to-pay cycle, from requisition to payment, ensuring efficiency and accuracy.
	Develop, implement, and enforce procurement policies, procedures, and ethical guidelines to ensure transparency, fairness, and accountability.
	Ensure compliance with all local, national, and international laws, regulations, and industry standards (e.g., food safety, health & safety, import/export).
	Identify and mitigate procurement-related risks, including supply chain disruptions, quality issues, and financial exposure.
	Implement sustainable procurement practices, considering environmental and social impacts in purchasing decisions.
	Forecast future procurement needs and market trends to proactively address potential supply chain disruptions and opportunities.
	Contribute to the annual budgeting process by providing accurate cost projections and identifying potential areas for cost reduction.
	Provide strong leadership, mentorship, and support to the procurement team, fostering a culture of teamwork, reliability, and a positive attitude, and identifying needs for role-specific training.
	Ensure that all procurement activities adhere strictly to internal policies, industry regulations, and requirements.
	Collaborate closely with all internal departments to understand their needs and ensure procurement supports their objectives.
	Provide expert advice and support to internal stakeholders on procurement-related matters.
	Participate in management meetings and contribute to overall business strategy.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, or a closely related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in procurement or supply chain management, with at least 3 years in a senior leadership or management capacity.
	Demonstrated expertise in strategic sourcing, complex contract negotiation, and robust supplier relationship management.
	Proven ability to drive significant cost savings and implement process improvements that lead to efficient day-to-day operations.
	Strong command of procurement software.


Required Competencies:


	Ability to develop high-level strategies while ensuring their seamless execution through efficient day-to-day tasks and operational precision.
	Proven capability to secure advantageous terms and build strong, reliable partnerships with suppliers, crucial for smooth operation.
	Exceptional ability to lead, mentor, and empower a diverse team, fostering teamwork.
	Strong analytical skills to interpret complex data and l enhance efficiency and smooth operation.
	Solid understanding of financial principles, budget management, and total cost of ownership to drive profitable and efficient procurement decisions.
	Outstanding verbal, written, and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively engage in customer interaction.


Mode of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: jobs.eclathrconsulting@gmail.com using "Head, Procurement, Abuja" as the email subject.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
